Waist circumference male equivalence is a **computed factor**. It means that it can be determined with total certainty from the user input.

#### Alternative names:
* Waist (male)
* Waist size as male
* Waist circumference as male
* Waist circumference male equivalence
* WaistMale

#### Input

Waist circumference male equivalence is computed with the following factors

* [Biological sex](/model/Sex)
* [Waist circumference](/model/Waist)

#### Uses

Waist circumference male equivalence is used by the model in the following places

* as a risk factor for [Diabetes condition](/model/DiabetesCondition)


### Optimizability

[Optimizability](/model/optimizabilities) is a subjective measure used to describe how easy it is to optimize a certain factor of your life. The optimizability of Waist circumference male equivalence is [4](/model/optimizabilities#category-4). This means that it can be interpreted as



> *It is possible to change, but it will take a lot of time.*


### Computation

For males this factor is just the waist circumference. For females, it is the waist circumference plus 14 centimeters.
